poem:
Title: "A Canticle of Commanders"

At dawn's light, we count presidents as stars,
Trump, in the basement, a flickering candle,
Biden ascends, like a bunking comet.
Rankings, swift and arbitrary, do play,
Yet Trump, even among calamitous peers, stays last,
While Biden enjoys the shine of love's soft cast.
In this seasonal game of power, who truly can say?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Donald Trump ranked as worst US president in history, with Joe Biden 14th Donald Trump finished 45th and rock bottom of a list ranking US presidents by greatness, trailing even “historically calamitous chief executives” who failed to stop the civil war or botched its aftermath. Related: Trump’s trial calendar becomes clearer – as do his delay tactics Worse for the likely Republican nominee this year, his probable opponent, Joe Biden, debuted at No 14. “Biden’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
